Takes the spot as my favorite game of all time!
Hilarious colony sim micromanager. 
Play it how you want. Hardcore no save scumming, save scumming, chaos, community builder, whatever.
The community is mod heavy and allows for a lot of switching things up if you prefer it that way. 
I often spend hours on this game. Coming from other 'sim' games, this one feels truly open world.
I also use mods to make this multiplayer and have a group of friends on the same map or even the same colony if preferred. 
You can find a way to play for any personality. Chaotic evil? Perfect. Lawful Good? You got it.
I'd pay way more than $25.00 for such a good game.

I like to start new combinations of characters, ideology, and environment. I like seeing creative animals like boomalope and muffalo. I usually play on classic mode because I like having enough time to build a colony and see it develop. The raids can get a little repetitive, but the DLCs add some fun elements. I highly recommend buying the DLCs. I haven't played Anomaly yet, but Biotech, Ideology and Royalty all add complexity to the game.

185934525.review:
[h1]为什么时隔7年之后，环世界依然是最好的那样类殖民模拟游戏？[/h1]
殖民模拟游戏加之上帝视角仅仅是他所呈现给你的第一印象，当深度了解其内核后会被他无微不至的细节所惊艳到。
[h1][quote=]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th] 欢迎关注 [b][u][i]U_U鉴赏家培养计划[/i][/u][/b][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [th] 关注U_U鉴赏家，开启精彩游戏之旅。 [/th]
    [/tr]
[/table]
[/quote][/h1]

在环世界这款殖民模拟游戏中，我们将以上帝视角进行殖民扩建，这是一个用上帝视角讲述一颗星球发展故事的一款游戏，在游戏中我们可以玩到的内容包括但并不限制于建造、种植、狩猎、看别人恋爱、做装备打仗、战俘等等，这款沙盒游戏本身的内容涵盖的玩法就极其广泛，又或者说“自由”，每个人都可以在游戏中找到适合自己的，自己喜欢的那种游玩方式。

故事的一开始交代了背景，在随后发展的5千年里，技术得到飞速发展，人们开始向外星进行殖民扩张，而一起事故令飞船发生了意外，仅有3位犯人逃出生天。而这也是我们开始游戏的第一个节点，我们可以创造人，创造独一无二的犯人，他们不完美，无法面面俱到，有的甚至还有伤，有的脑子不好使这些都有可能，甚至是器官功能的衰竭令其难以拥有过多的时间生存也不是什么罕见的事情。而当创建完角色后，我们也开始了异星殖民之旅。

随后的选择是选择降落点，在这颗星球之中自然地貌并不算少从山川湖泊，绿林沼泽，甚至是沙漠戈壁都齐全，生存是第一要事，同时星球上的原住民“海盗”还会趁你不注意偷偷的对你发起进攻。有持刀也有持枪，当真真正正挨上那么一下，失血过多休克是小事，而真正死亡减少作业人数才是大问题。

建筑可能不是最有趣，但肯定是最重要的，我们可以拥有一个容身之所。通过操控3个小人在空无一物的荒原捡起房屋，从清理地上的乱石和砍去碍事的树木后，就开始建造了，建造也并非是一下子就生成的，有那个建造的过程，看着小人搬运木头，堆砌石头，实干更强，我认为真实感也是游戏沉浸感足不足的一环。此外建造房屋时也并不是画个圆圈就是家了，我们需要通过合理的规划令小人的工作效率达到最高，在同样的时间内做到更多的事情才是首位。

每个人物都有自己擅长的一面和不擅长的一面，就好比a擅长手工活但是不会种植，而b恰好会种植但是不会手工，c全部都会但是并不熟练，如何合理的分配小人到各自对应的岗位上进行作业也是一门讲究，尽然有序的安排事件？等待其自然运转即可？实则不然，如果并非选择最低难度，那么在游戏会随机刷新天灾，从雷暴到海啸，甚至是蔓延的瘟疫攻击着你的营地，是不是有几个原住民来骚扰你，如果所恰好碰上外出打猎获取食材的时候，那么真的是不凑巧，今天的饭就没有着落了，人们的健康状态会下降，而和海盗间的战斗又不至于毫发无损，在精神压力和物质基础都无法满足的情况下，人就会生病，甚至死亡，这类事件在游戏中也常常发生，对此决策并不单单是单调的，需要有有预防未知事件发生的能力，我觉得是本作的一大亮点。

本身丰富的内容量本体就足够你游玩上百个小时，不论是专精一项例如狩猎战斗，或者是搞搞基地建设又或者是喜欢观察人类都能找到属于自己的一个舒服的玩法。坦白说一开始看到商店简介描述的“小说”，多少是有些许疑惑的，但是随着游玩时间的增长，令我意识到里面的角色都有着自己细腻的性格，有喜欢的东西和讨厌的东西，擅长的和不擅长的，正是这些不完美令其更为真实，这就是这款游戏最为细节的点，同样也是最令我着迷的点。可不就是一本活脱脱的上帝小说嘛，以上帝的视角欣赏着小人们运作。

而除了本体之外，官方还推出了两个大体量的dlc，一个皇权，一个文化，同样值得你细细品味，而真正能保证游戏经久不衰的原因，我想多半还是因为环世界支持创意工坊，海量的mod令整个游戏都焕发升级，下载一个mod能开拓出一种崭新的玩法，更多的怪物，更复杂的地形地势？又或者是更少的资源搭配天灾人祸进而升级成为超级超级难的沙盒游戏都不是问题。如何游玩全凭你选择。

总的来说，环世界是一款极其耐玩的沙盒游戏，但是本身的上手有着一定的门槛，如果对于殖民模拟类游戏不感兴趣，又或者更加喜欢于亲自下场进行建造、狩猎的朋友，那么这款游戏是否购入还需要考虑。但一旦沉下心来细细品味，我想他会给你数百小时的曼妙体验~！

185923708.review:
[h1] RimWorld Review: A Chaotic Symphony of Storytelling [/h1]

[b]Gameplay[/b] - 🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀 (5/5) - Managing colonists is like running a daycare for geniuses, pyromaniacs, and socially inept alpacas.

[b]Storytelling[/b] - 📖📖📖📖📖 (5/5) - You will get emotionally attached to the guy who lost his leg to a squirrel attack.

[b]Graphics[/b] - 🎨🎨 (2/5) - Let’s just call it “functional pixel art” and move on, shall we?

[b]Difficulty[/b] - 💀💀💀💀💀 (5/5) - Think “Dark Souls,” but instead of dragons, it’s food shortages, infections, and Karen the raider.

[b]Replayability[/b] - 🔁🔁🔁🔁🔁 (5/5) - Every playthrough is a new soap opera. Will you thrive or end up eating Jeff? (Spoiler: It’s Jeff.)

[b]Sound Design[/b] - 🎵🎵🎵🎵 (4/5) - Relaxing, until a mechanoid raid makes you choke on your coffee.

[b]Colonist AI[/b] - 🤖🤖 (2/5) - Why does Steve insist on cleaning the dirt outside while bleeding to death?

[b]Modding Community[/b] - 🔧🔧🔧🔧🔧 (5/5) - From medieval kingdoms to “RimWorld: Pokémon Edition,” the possibilities are endless.

Overall Score: 10/10 (Or is it a 1/10?)

This game is less about winning and more about watching a beautifully chaotic disaster unfold, laughing, crying, and occasionally screaming at your monitor. Would recommend.

185915412.review:
Probably THE game for me. If I was stranded on a desert island with one game to play it would be Rimworld every time. The endless customization, the emergent storytelling, the “one more turn” mentality (even if it’s realtime), there’s something so incredibly addicting about Rimworld. Don’t let the graphics fool you. This is a HARDCORE colony sim. Add in mods and well, you’ve got a recipe for a game that will stand the test of time. 

It took everything that was stellar about dwarf fortress and upped it by X10. Incredible game.

185871025.review:
[h1]The Most Overhyped Game in Steam History?[/h1]
I've spent like 5+ hours watching YouTube videos just to figure out the basics of playing this game. From what I can tell, that's normal, because this game's tutorial is abysmal. I can't really recommend this game. It's like a SIMs game where you're building a base in space, except the SIMs are dumb and don't prioritize tasks very well. You can manually set priorities but while you're managing all of that; the game is constantly sending increasingly difficult waves of enemies at you. Combat in this game is not fun; the meta is basically to have one Colonist kiting and the rest just shoot at the enemies. I think if the combat was semi-automatic I would be fine but it takes away from the "Colonist Autonomy" fantasy of this game when combat is completely up to me.

And this game [b]harshly punishes[/b] you in combat and takes no prisoners. Every time combat happens; there is a very good chance your Colonist is going to die. When you only start with 3 Colonists; each loss screws you over pretty badly because the enemies will continue to get increasingly difficult despite the fact that you're now making only 2/3 or 1/3 of your original progress.

The trailer makes the Colonists look extremely 3-dimensional but really they're not. It's all just survival meters and they don't "develop" quite like the trailer suggests. This game doesn't really give the characters time to develop anyway because 99% of the time your characters will just get stabbed and die. You have a finite amount of medicine and it takes forever to get to the research point where you can produce your own Medicine.

And stuff like the above is why I find this game so frustrating. It pretends to be open-ended and you can do whatever you want - but there is [b]very clearly[/b] a tech and research path that you have to take in order to progress in the game at all. In 20 hours, I have not had a [i]single[/i] playthrough make it to 4 Colonists, let alone 5. After I watched more YouTube videos, I figured out to optimize your playthrough you just have to sit at the beginning screen and randomize colonists until you get "good" starting characteristics on your 3 starters. It's maddening how much stuff in this game is completely RNG-dependent and outside of your control.

All this to say - I don't get the hype and definitely not the "Overwhelmingly Positive" aspect of this game. I found this game to be an exercise in futility. A game is not fun when you spend 99% of the time at 3X Speed just to get through all the mundane daily tasks. The "stories" being told and generated are not even displayed properly. You have to go into a separate Colonist Menu on each separate colonist just to see what they're experiencing and  what they're going through. Despite that being such a major part of the trailer; the stories are not even close to as nuanced and thorough as the trailer would make you believe.

TL;DR
[b]This game is just not fun[/b]. It's an idle time-waster at best and a micromanagement heavy SIMs game with extremely clunky combat at worst.

185776561.review:
RimWorld non è solo un gioco; è una piattaforma per raccontare storie indimenticabili. Sviluppato da Ludeon Studios, questo simulatore di colonia si distingue per il suo approccio unico alla gestione delle risorse, alla sopravvivenza e alla narrazione emergente.  

Gameplay Profondo e Coinvolgente
Il cuore di RimWorld è il suo gameplay gestionale incredibilmente profondo. Dalla costruzione della base alla gestione della salute mentale dei coloni, ogni decisione ha conseguenze tangibili. Che tu stia combattendo una minaccia aliena, respingendo pirati o cercando di sopravvivere a un'invasione di ratti assassini, ogni sfida è un'opportunità per mettere alla prova la tua capacità strategica.  

L’intelligenza artificiale del Narratore, con opzioni come Cassandra Classic, Phoebe Chillax e Randy Random, aggiunge un livello di imprevedibilità unico. La combinazione di eventi casuali e scelte del giocatore crea storie emergenti che restano impresse nella memoria.  

Personalizzazione e Libertà Creativa
RimWorld eccelle nella personalizzazione. Grazie a un vasto sistema di mod supportato dalla community, il gioco può essere adattato a qualsiasi stile di gioco. Vuoi un'avventura fantascientifica piena di mech? O magari un'esperienza medievale più "down-to-earth"? RimWorld lo rende possibile.  

Narrazione Emotiva
Ciò che davvero distingue RimWorld è la narrazione. I coloni non sono solo pedine, ma personaggi unici con tratti, relazioni e aspirazioni. Assistere alla nascita di una storia come l’amicizia tra un ex pirata e un robot o il sacrificio di un colono per salvare il gruppo è qualcosa di straordinariamente coinvolgente.  

Grafica e Audio Essenziali
Sebbene la grafica sia minimalista, la direzione artistica fa miracoli. Ogni elemento è chiaro e funzionale, il che permette di concentrarsi sul gameplay e sulle storie. La colonna sonora, composta da Alistair Lindsay, crea un'atmosfera rilassante che contrasta con le tensioni che il gioco sa generare.  

Conclusione 
RimWorld non è per chi cerca un'esperienza veloce o lineare, ma per chi ama immergersi in mondi complessi e dinamici. È un’esperienza unica, capace di sorprendere, emozionare e divertire anche dopo centinaia di ore di gioco.  

Se ami i giochi di gestione, la strategia e la narrazione, RimWorld è un acquisto imprescindibile. Non è solo un gioco: è un laboratorio di storie epiche, pronte a essere raccontate e vissute.

185744995.review:
This game is for a very specific type of person. I am not that person. It starts out fun, but quickly devolves into micromanagement hell. 

Micromanagement: Early game there is a lot of variety and it can be fun and challenging responding to all of the random catastrophes, but very quickly you will start to get annoyed with how little autonomy your pawns (the people in your colony) actually have. They are dumb. Really really dumb. They have to be constantly monitored and managed and there is no easy way to make them do certain things. If they are starving for fun, you can't order them to play a game or go outside, instead you have to open a work schedule menu, set their schedule to recreation, then have them halt what they are doing multiple times. Why Ludeon, why? If you don't waste your time doing that then they will fly into a rage and insult all of your other colonists (an effect that stacks, lasts for days, and can completely destroy that colonist's mood, again, wtf Ludeon?) or break your most expensive important machine. This is just nonsense. 

Components: Another very annoying thing is that every important thing you build requires parts called components. Components can't be mfg until very late game so you have to get them from trading or, if you're lucky and they are on your map, mining. This is fine until no traders or trade ships come for an entire year or something else like that, during which time you are basically soft locked. Too weak technologically to leave your colony of braindead pawns to fend for itself while you travel, you just have to wait it out while you farm or do whatever else. You will learn that there are things you can do to make this less likely to happen, but the game may throw a wrench in your plans by striking down half your pawns with malaria or the plague as you attempt to do so. This can get very frustrating very quickly. 

Scaling difficulty with colony wealth: Should you succeed in planning better and building nicer things, the game will punish you by massively increasing the size of the raids against your colony due to the colony's wealth increasing. This too is annoying since in order to have the colonists not throw tantrums they have to be in a good mood, and in order to be in a good mood they have to have nice things. This mechanic means that the simple act of replacing all your wood or dirt floors with sandstone tiles could add 2 to 3 more enemies on the next raid. You didn't get better guns. You didn't get better weapons or more colonists. All you did was add some nice floors to help your colonists not go crazy. I hate this mechanic. 

Overall, it's not the worst game and I can see why people love it, but the lack of autonomy of the pawns, over-reliance on components, and scaling raids just for replacing your dirt floors with stone all combine to ruin it for me.

⭐ Rimworld : une aventure unique à chaque partie ! ⭐

Rimworld est bien plus qu'un simple jeu de gestion ou de survie. C'est un générateur d'histoires qui mêle drames humains, défis tactiques, et créativité sans limite. Chaque colon a ses forces, ses faiblesses et sa propre personnalité, ce qui rend chaque partie incroyablement immersive.

Que ce soit en construisant un avant-poste florissant, en affrontant une horde de raiders, ou en survivant à des épidémies d'origine mystérieuse, chaque décision a des conséquences, souvent imprévisibles. Le jeu brille par sa richesse, son humour parfois noir et ses mods qui prolongent l'expérience bien au-delà de l'imaginable.

Pour ceux qui aiment les jeux exigeants, narratifs, et infiniment rejouables, Rimworld est un chef-d'œuvre. Une pépite indémodable que je recommande à tous les fans de simulation et de stratégie.

185715038.review:
76 hours in, and I'm still playing through the initial tutorial colony. Haven't even scratched the surface of this amazing game.

BLUF: It's a colony sim that allows almost complete freedom in how you manage and build it. If you manage poorly, people will be unhappy and you'll get destroyed by raiders or a dozen other potential hostile events. You want to be a war criminal? Go for it. You want to invest countless resources in improving the livesof your pawns? Go for it.

Combat is unforgiving and refreshingly realistic. If you send your pawn out in the open with no armor against enemies with guns, they are going to die or become mortally wounded. Same if you don't utilize cover.

There are about a dozen skills that your pawns can be proficient in. You need to recruit people with the relevant skills you require through diplomacy or through capture and imprisonment. These skills range from cooking to technical research. If you don't have a proficient cook, you'll be at high risk of food poisoning. If you don't have a researcher, you'll be using bow and arrows for the entire game.

The game is hard where it needs to be but not to the point that it becomes frustrating. For example, there is no ammo requirement for your guns except for the heavy weapons like mortars. This means if you make an assault rifle it's ready to shoot infinitely until destroyed or lost. Same with bows.

If you don't like micromanaging, this game isn't for you. The pawns are smart but you need to be constantly engaged in their priorities and schedules. Combat is 20% of this game. The rest is colony management and survival

9/10

185589384.review:
So honestly about the game. It's a fantastic platform for the community to improve upon the foundation that the developers created. Game on its own is rather bland especially without DLCs and mods. 

Another gripe becomes apparent after creating larger colonies, with or without mods (with mods is far quicker). And it is the fact that RimWorld is a single threaded game, which means it will only utilise a single core in your CPU. Therefore the game is prone to this bottleneck. One solution is to have a CPU that has larger cores and therefore less of them so it depends on what you really need it for otherwise. The other is harder to achieve. Use fewer mods. I know it's hard, I struggle myself.

However even this can't really stop me from playing this game. The community is always expanding and it is the reason this game is as successful as it is. So I definitely recommend it, expansions too. I know they are a little overpriced but in the end it's worth it. I spend more money on games I play much lass than this sooo...yeah.

Take care and don't forget to build the table first.

Played since Alpha's. Was here to witness it go 1.0 and then receive massive DLCs, which (in my opinion) are 100% worth the value even without discounts.

[h1]Addictive, better than Dwarf Fortress, with a lot of different mods to satisfy any type of playthrough or roleplaying.[/h1] (I have 963 mods currently and it's growing endlessly, I'm the hoarding bug of mods)

A significant amount of content and experiences can be provided by base game and DLCs.
However, Vanilla Expanded series is the best starting point, if you want to start engaging with the mods after vanilla. I recommend using RimSort to sort the mod load order and avoid errors. Look up some optimization guides/spreadsheets too, to have a smoother experience even with ridicilous amounts of mods.

10/10 game of the mankind.

185554616.review:
Maybe you're looking at reviews of games, trying to decide if the cost is going to be offset by the fun you'll get out of the purchase. I was in that same boat just a few years ago. I took the plunge after waiting for a seasonal sale, and got to experience Rimworld for the first time.

It's a pretty simple concept, depending on settings you select when building the world/game you are in loose control of some characters who are stranded on a weird planet. In some settings you start with some gear and supplies, while in one you can start with literally nothing. Like other survival games, the first goal is making shelter, getting food, establishing some sense of security. You don't directly control the characters, rather you set up tasks for them to complete. If you don't set up tasks they have some autonomy, but usually don't make the best decisions.

Eventually, after researching ever-improving technologies, there is an option to build a starship and escape the planet. This involves extensive research, materials gathering, and finally fending off invading raiders as the ship starts up.

But getting to this point can take as little or as much time as you want to throw at this game. I've played saved games for literally years before moving on to the "ending".

If you have a "comfort" show or movie you've seen over and over again, this game is for you. It's my comfort game. Wish I could recommend it more than just one thumbs-up.

185514208.review:
A Hilarious Colony Simulation with a Pyromania Guarantee

RimWorld is the game where you think you can build the perfect colony – only to watch it all go down in a massive inferno. It's like an endless experiment in testing how far you can stretch your nerves. Here’s my detailed review:

Positive Aspects:

Endless Possibilities: RimWorld offers countless ways to design and manage your colony. Do you want a peaceful community of farmers? Or perhaps a rough group of mercenaries? The choice is entirely yours.

Complex Gameplay: The depth and complexity of the game are impressive. From resource management to optimizing workflows – there’s always something to do.

Unpredictable Events: The game is packed with unexpected events. Whether it's a meteor strike, a horde of wild animals, or an unexpected visit from pirates – you never know what will happen next.

Unique Colonists: Each colonist has their own skills, weaknesses, and personality traits. You quickly develop a bond with them – only to watch them go up in flames.

Modding Community: The modding community is fantastic. There are countless mods that expand and improve the game, so it never gets boring.

Negative Aspects:

Inferno Guarantee: It seems almost inevitable that your colony will go up in flames sooner or later. Maybe it’s the pyromaniac colonists, maybe it’s a lightning strike – but one thing is for sure: It will burn.

Random Disasters: Sometimes the random disasters are just unfair. Just when you think everything is going well, fate strikes mercilessly.

Steep Learning Curve: The game is not exactly beginner-friendly. The learning curve is steep and requires a lot of patience and experimentation.

Emotional Attachment: You develop a strong attachment to your colonists, which makes it all the more painful when they meet their tragic end. Tears are inevitable.

Conclusion: RimWorld is an incredibly deep and entertaining game that can captivate you for hours – provided you have the nerves for it. The unpredictable events and emotional attachment to the colonists make it a unique experience. However, be warned: The likelihood of your colony ending up in a sea of flames is high. But hey, who doesn't love a bit of chaos and destruction?

Rating: 8/10

185353554.review: I've been playing RimWorld for what feels like an eternity. First recommended to me by my daughter's godfather, it has been one one of the highest played games on my Steam list. If you enjoy a good colony builder, RimWorld is the game for you. If you want to experience being a slaver or building a domineering cult, get the Ideology cult. If you want vampires or dog people or you want to raise babies, get the Biotech pack. If you'd like to build an Empire and become a King, Royalty is the pack for you. The new Anomaly pack adds horror elements to the game to increase the thrill factor but I have, admittedly, not been able to that that one (YET!). This game is one of those ones that is almost entirely unique and no playthrough is ever the same. The devs have been working on this game with devotion for over a decade. Every cent invested is worth it - hands down.

Rimworld

Where to start?
Ever want to play a game where you can have a character become a full bionic monstrosity, command an army of killer robots, and decimate nations all on their own, just for a rat to chew your leg off, knock the bionic man out, and you sit, watching them not heal themselves and lose the run? 

If you thought "Damn, no." 

Well, then turn away. This game is chaotic. 
It can be a fun survival simulator.
A farming game.
A lonely mech ruler's rise to insanity.
Or just Squirrel, the prisoner, being harvested for blood, but living a life 10x better than when they were free. 

This game, and the DLC, provide a vast experience for you, your friends, you're parents, and even the ghost haunting your attic. 
Take the dive. 


Jokes aside. Rimworld is truly a vast and random chaotic fever dream that will have you telling your friends the oddest sentences, or googling things that would potentially put you on a watch list.

185180152.review:
Rimworld is chaos, plain and simple. One minute you’re minding your business, building your base, and the next, your colony is on fire because the AI decided it was time for a raid and a blight at the same time.

The best part? It somehow all works. The world [b]feels alive,[/b] with random events and weird little stories that make every colony unique. Mods make it even crazier—want dinosaurs? Alien invasions? You have it.

[h3]The Great[/h3]
[list]
[*]Watching your colony go from disaster to functional (or not).
[*]The mix of sci-fi, medieval vibes, and eldritch weirdness.
[*]The modding community is insane in the best way.
[/list]
[h3]The Not so Great[/h3]
[list]
[*]The UI is... [b]a lot, sometimes.[/b] Mods help, but without them, it can get clunky.
[*]On easier settings, the game can get a bit predictable over time.
[/list]

Yeah, it’s a bit pricey, but honestly? [i]Worth every cent for the stories it creates.[/i]

185150854.review:
This is one of my favorite games. It's a rich story generator, and the gameplay is engrossing and expansive. It's also very customizable in terms of experience, even without mods, which often change or refine the game mechanics or add new content. Even after 200 hours I'm learning new things, and always finding ways to make my colony more efficient. I love the drama and role play and the ability to be so absurdly evil. I'm very fond of human sacrifice, organ harvesting, and selling people into slavery.

Rimworld does have its downsides. Some aspects of gameplay involve more micromanagement than I'd like, the UI is decent at best, and it's overall a janky experience. The game is also very poorly optimized. Large colonies with lots of items tank my frame rate to around 30, but even running at its best, the game wildly fluctuates between 50 and 90fps and only uses 20% of my GPU and CPU. Unfortunately no frame cap solutions have worked for me.

Even with the flaws, this is one of the best games I've ever played.

185150286.review: I love this game so much. I can't stop playing it. Highly recommend. It's just a fantastic game all around.

[h3][b]Rimworld  [/b][/h3]
—[i]Where [b]Chaos [/b] and [b]Storytelling [/b] Collide [/i]

[b][i]Review: [/i][/b]
Rimworld isn’t just a game—it’s a mix of [b]survival, storytelling,[/b] and [i]absolute madness.[/i] After [b]300+ hours [/b] of building colonies, fighting off raiders, and [i]accidentally setting my base on fire[/i] (thanks, Randy Random), I can confidently say this game never gets old. Every playthrough feels fresh, thanks to its [b]unpredictable events[/b] and the [i]insane twists[/i] that keep you guessing.

If you want to experience [b]true chaos,[/b] try [b]Randy Random[/b] as your AI storyteller. One moment, you’ll be peacefully farming; the next, [i]a herd of angry elephants[/i] will storm your base. Randy doesn’t care about balance—[b]he’s here to throw surprises[/b] that will completely change how you play.

[b][u]Why I Love It: [/u][/b]
[list]
[*] Your colonists are a mix of [b]geniuses, troublemakers,[/b] and people who can [i]barely tie their own shoes.[/i]
[*] The game writes its own [b]crazy stories.[/b] One minute, everything is fine. The next, your best colonist is [i]fighting off a bear[/i] while your chef burns dinner.
[*] [b]Mods![/b] If you want it, there’s a mod for it. [i]Battle rhinos? Alien invasions?[/i] You name it.
[/list]
[b][u]Funny Things I’ve Learned: [/u][/b]
[olist]
[*] Rimworld isn’t about [b]winning[/b]—it’s about [i]laughing while everything falls apart.[/i]
[*] Colonist relationships are [b]messy.[/b] They’ll become [i]best friends—or start a fistfight over the last slice of pizza.[/i]
[*] The AI storyteller loves chaos. [b]Randy Random,[/b] especially, turns your colony into a [i]rollercoaster of unexpected disasters[/i] and plot twists.
[/olist]
[b][i]Why It’s Special: [/i][/b]
There are other games like Rimworld out there, but [b]nothing beats the original.[/b] It’s not just about building—it’s about the [i]crazy stories[/i] and the [b]unpredictable disasters[/b] that make every game unique.

[b][i]Final Thoughts: [/i][/b]
Rimworld is one of those games you [b]keep coming back to.[/b] Whether you’re fighting off raiders, trying to keep your colonists alive, or just [i]watching it all burn (literally),[/i] it’s always fun.

184989722.review:
For the best experience, click on the thumbs up blue button on this review to see it in the big format!
Average reading time: 5 minutes.

[h1]What is Rimworld?[/h1]
Rimworld is a colony sim game where you manage survivors and try to keep them alive on a planet full of ruthless people, mythical creatures, animals, and machines that all follow the same creed: "Your stuff is mine, and if you don't give it to me I kill you."  It is a title where you spend as much time fighting the climate, lack of food, and all sorts of complications that come with establishing a new colony for your survivors to thrive (or perish) in.

What makes Rimworld such a masterwork cult game is that the game is truly fascinating in how realistic and dynamic its interactions play. People love each other, but they hate each other, if you get hurt and you don't treat the wound it becomes a major problem, you can get food poisoning and sometimes your survivors will decapitate enemies in seconds while other times they miss all their shots or have a mental breakdown. Each pawn has their needs that need to be satisfied like a human does in real life, they need to be fed, need to sleep, have fun, feel safe, and feel like their lives are both fulfilling and an achievement.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3402397747

It's thanks to such an intricate system, that Rimworld is outstanding when it comes to roleplay. Whenever you want to be a Royal Knight and be honorable, save stragglers, make a difference, or run a cult of secluded cannibals that will hunt down anyone in their territory, Rimworld lets you shape the beliefs and technology of your civilization. The Ideology DLC takes this to the next level, giving perks that are both incredibly useful and frustrating based on what memes your colonists believe in. The game is all about making your own story as you play.

[h1]My Experience With Rimworld[/h1]
I did five playthroughs before reviewing the game, and those colonies all perished horribly except for one. Each run felt fresh to me as I could pursue multiple directions to take my colony, but the best one was playing the modded race Ratkin and becoming a vassal of the Empire. Establishing my own medieval Kingdom where we use ballistas, and double swords (like Dark Maul from Star Wars} and getting Psychodelic magical powers by pleasing the Empire was incredibly fun. I loved the hunt for legendary weapons that can give you fame and power, and using necromancy and techno-magic I was able to create an everlasting society that will stand the test of time.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3402396966

In another playthrough, I was a lone Ratkin (I love my rats) with three androids, and the gameplay changed drastically from my previous 3 Rats in Royalty. With androids, you can make things happen faster because they never sleep, hence having a 24/7 minion becomes extremely useful and desirable but for all their pros, androids cannot do tasks like cook or be social, which affects how you approach the game as you only have one colonist doing all the stuff androids won't do. It is in that philosophy that we can see Rimworld is a game one can play for ages. I don't play games for a long time, and you can check my hours and know I enjoy my time in Rimworld and will continue to do so! I don't even like Sims management games so that speaks volumes!

That being said, some minor frustrations here and there. Sometimes the game would bug and require development tools to fix it, while at other times the game can kind of abruptly end your tale. Is realistic but not super fun when your awesome melee fighter instantly gets taken out in one smooth swing (personally, I wouldn't be thrilled about it) while in other opportunities the co-writer to the story called the StoryTeller (an AI that decides what events come your way) can be your best friend that sends you milk or your worst enemy that woke up one morning and said "yeah you are getting raided 7 times today" (big shoutout to Randy Random, best storyteller in my humble opinion) so in those cases, you might need to modify your experience to get the most of it, whenever that be an easier difficulty, a particular approach or starting with more knowledge(or hitting the super hardcore difficulty, I mean, if that is what you are into!).

[h1]The Price of Rimworld And Modding[/h1]
Rimworld is a very expensive game, like for real, an extremely pricey game to get. To get the most out of the modding community and the game, you are basically looking to pay 120 bucks, and trust me, while you can enjoy the base game and no mods, Rimworld is a game MEANT to be modded. Is like day and night without it and mods depend on the DLC so not having the DLC means some of the best mods won't work at all.

That being said, you can acquire this in pieces. Personally, I played the base game on my first playthrough, modded the second, and for the other three, I got all DLC and 200-ish mods. When you get into the meat of it, Rimworld is a game you can play forever and is awesome to see how the community always brings something new and exciting to it, how the players keep the game not only alive but expand it with crazy goofy ideas that are marvelous to play through. My personal fav goes to the Ratkin and Vanilla Expanded, french kiss mods that make Rimworld one of the best games you could ever play.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3402397492

As for the DLCs, personally (hot take incoming), I disliked Biotech for a while, then I loved it, and now I am like, "Hmm, it's okay, I guess." I know it is a fan favorite, but I am just more into Royalty and Ideology, where I make my own culture and develop it over time. Anomaly is also incredibly fun, but only for a playthrough or two, very limited but enjoyable nonetheless. Oh right my justifications, uhh...I dislike Biotech cause research takes a lot of time and resources are a pain to get, I love Royalty cause who doesn't love shooting ice bolts or resurrecting enemies to serve as minions from death, I like Ideology cause I get to make my own rules with pros and cons, and finally I enjoy Anomaly cause touching a funny rock and summoning the invisible skinwalker is just gonna do wonders for my colony (sips coffee) not. Curiosity does kill the cat, or in this case the funny rock (I cannot leave it alone, help).

[h1]Is Rimworld Worth Your Time, Your Money? [/h1]
No. I jest, YES IT IS! Rimworld is honestly one of the most amazing games I played, worth every cent and every minute. Is a fantastical journey where every playthrough is a story to be told and a tale of success, sacrifice, drama, and loss. When you lose a colonist, you feel it in your bones, is painful and sad but that's what makes them valuable, the joy (and frustrations) you share with these little bits of data. 

Whenever you want to be more medieval and destroy hi-tech people (like I do) make alliances or I don't know, be a cannibalistic colony with a lot of flavors of "I exploit everyone else for my sake" (feeling daring today aren't we?} Rimworld is a mirror, through which you can explore infinite stories and have all the emotional rollercoaster that the experience is forever. Do yourself a favor and get the game, I mean I don't like sims games and I love it.

[H3]10/10 MASTERPIECE [/H3]

184928840.review: Honestly, I did not think I would enjoy Rimworld. Although I am a huge fan of colony sim base build types of games, at first look I never really thought this would be a game for me. I was happily mistaken and Rimworld has become one of the best games I have played in such a long time. At first, you may dislike the old style of graphics but it grows on you and I actually ended up liking it. I found this game after it was recommended to me by a friend and I'm glad they did. The game-play is easy enough for new gamers but also can be a lot of fun for experienced gamers. Depending on your game-play style this can be a fast-paced game or a slow grind relaxing game. Personally, I love games where I can relax watch a movie, and play, and Rimworld worked perfectly for me in that sense. The base game itself is entertaining and I have got a few of the DLCs which added so much more dynamic to the game. I have not tried all of the DLCs yet but I do plan to as I have found that each one made the game feel fresh again. In the beginning, the controls can be a little confusing but guides online helped me to learn anything I was stuck on. I decided to play in the game style my friend plays where you do a role-play with your characters. it was a lot of fun and I had used my IRL friends as inspiration for the characters in my game. Although the Role-play did get a little more difficult over time as i ended up with a massive colony. I do recommend also trying some mods if you want to spice up the game a little there are so many good ponces out there for almost anything, even cosmetic ones to make your characters more interesting or even ones to add extra content into the game. Give this game a try as i am sure you will enjoy it, and even girl gamers will enjoy this speaking from a females point of view.

184882055.review:
[h1] ===[ 📊 Rating ]=== [/h1] 
✔️ 100/100 
This colony-sim is a story-game in disguise. I highly recommend playing on commitment mode for that so you can’t play safe and reload anytime. I encountered everything from a simple mad rat biting of my ear which then gets infected and I die to a bad cook making all my pawns vomit so they couldn’t get their work done and we all froze to death as soon as the winter started to a massive flesh-monster-pit opening going in mission impossible style, setting everything on fire and then, right at the end a pawn got downed. I left him behind because rescuing him would be mean sure dead for the whole squad. Then, as the massive pit started to collapse and my left behind pawn had 1h until the blood loss would kill him, I went in there, rescuing him last second just for him later to get hit by a jade-meteoroid… All little and huge encounters are so story and lore heavy when they truly mean something (aka perma-death). Moreover, after every few hours on a new map I still, after 700h, get so many new ideas on how and where to build next or and what ideologies to try next or… this game is a true gem, and I am not even counting all the workshop-items for it! THERE IS SO MUCH WORKSHOP-CONTENT! You can literally play a totally different game just with the free bonus content from other Rimworld-lovers. Amazing. Buy it. This would be the 1 game I would take to a deserted island so I can easily sink 1000h+ into it and not even remembering that I have to eat, sleep or get rescued…

Tek kelimeyle muhteşem bi oyun 10/10. Sandbox ve simülasyon oyunlarını seven ve yıllardır oynayan biri olarak diyorum ki core oyun gerçekten hikayesi istediğiniz yere gidebilecek ve aradığınız ne duygu varsa yaşatabilecek bir oyun.

Şu anki save'im sağcılardan oluşan bir koloniden oluşuyor. Ömer Faruk Ümmü Gülsüm'ün babası. Ümmü Gülsüm ana ekibimizdendi Ömer Faruk şansa uzayda kaza yapıp düştü Ümmü Gülsüm'ün babası olduğu için hapsettik ve zorla yanımıza aldık aileyi bozmayalım diye. Ömer Faruk'u yanımıza alınca bağlı olduğu ulus bize sinirlendi ve saldıracaklarını söylediler. Çok umursamadık açıkçası çünkü baba ve kızı buluşturduk en önemlisi bu.  Aradan zaman geçti ve o ulus bize saldırıya geldi. Biz o sırada 4 kişiyiz. Ümmü Gülsüm, Sudenaz, Ömer Faruk ve Alev. Alev dümenden sağcı, kim baştaysa onu destekliyor o yüzden isim olarak yargılamayın onu. Saldıranlar da 4 kişi. Adettendir bi kontrol ederim kimin nesi kimin fesi saldıranlar ne takıyorlar falan. Araştırmam sırasında karşı ulusun liderinin geldiğini gördüm. Çok normal bir şey değil bu basit bi saldırı için gelmesi. Bi baktım lider kadın(Helene), Ömer Faruk'un eski eşi ve Ümmü Gülsüm'ün üvey annesi. Yakın zamanda oğlunu ve aynı zamanda Ömer Faruk'un üvey çocuğunu kaybetmenin yasıyla sanırım eski eşi ve üvey evladını geri almak için kendi de geldi. Bunun farkında olduğum için Ümmü Gülsüm ve Ömer Faruk'u yolladım konuşmaları için. Durum düşündüğümüz gibi değilmiş pek, Helene yaşadığı acıyla birlikte ateş açmaya başladı. Ümmü Gülsüm'ün omzundan giren mermi ağır yaraladı, kızını o durumda gören Ömer Faruk doğru olanı yapıp Helene'i ebediyete uğurladı. Ne yazık ki iyileşme sürecinde enfeksiyon kaptı hastalık ve Ümmü Gülsüm'ü kaybettik . Ömer Faruk da eşinin canını almak ve yakın zamanda üvey oğlunun kayıp haberinin üstüne bide kızını kaybettikten sonra depresyona girip çok kısa sürede hayata gözlerini yumdu. 

Bi tık da hayat değil mi Rimworld, aileyi birleştirmek için koloniye katılan aileden yaklaşık 1 ay içinde sadece bi tane erkek çocuk kaldı Helene'in ikinci evliliğinden. Belki ileride intikama gelir? Ama intikam alacağı kimsenin kalmadığını biliyor mu? Yaşayıp göreceğiz.

184817342.review:
RimWorld: Ein Meisterwerk der Simulation und Strategie

RimWorld ist eines dieser Spiele, das man einmal startet und Stunden später erstaunt feststellt, wie die Zeit vergangen ist. Es vereint eine unglaubliche Tiefe mit grenzenloser Kreativität und bietet ein Spielerlebnis, das seinesgleichen sucht. Als Spieler übernimmst du die Kontrolle über eine kleine Gruppe von Überlebenden, die auf einem fremden Planeten gestrandet sind – und ab diesem Moment erzählt das Spiel seine ganz eigene Geschichte.

Die größte Stärke von RimWorld liegt zweifellos in der dynamischen Story-Engine. Kein Durchlauf gleicht dem anderen, da jedes Ereignis, jede Entscheidung und jede zufällige Wendung das Spielgeschehen nachhaltig beeinflusst. Ob es ein Angriff von Piraten, ein tobender Sandsturm oder der plötzliche Wahnsinn eines Kolonisten ist – RimWorld überrascht immer wieder und fordert den Spieler, kreativ zu denken.

Die Grafiken mögen auf den ersten Blick einfach wirken, aber sie täuschen über die unglaubliche Komplexität des Spiels hinweg. Jede Kolonistin und jeder Kolonist hat eine eigene Persönlichkeit, Vorlieben, Abneigungen und Beziehungen. Die KI des Spiels, der sogenannte "Erzähler", sorgt dafür, dass es nie langweilig wird. Man kann zwischen verschiedenen Erzählerstilen wählen, die von entspannt bis chaotisch reichen – perfekt, um das Spiel an die eigenen Vorlieben anzupassen.

Die Modding-Community verdient ebenfalls eine besondere Erwähnung. RimWorld ist ein Spiel, das durch Mods beinahe endlos erweitert werden kann. Von neuen Fraktionen und Technologien bis hin zu Lebenssimulationen und kosmetischen Verbesserungen – die Möglichkeiten sind schier unendlich.

Was RimWorld aber wirklich besonders macht, ist die emotionale Bindung, die man zu seiner Kolonie aufbaut. Es ist herzzerreißend, einen geliebten Kolonisten zu verlieren, aber ebenso triumphierend, nach einem schweren Schicksalsschlag wieder aufzustehen und die Kolonie weiterzuführen. Es ist ein Spiel, das zeigt, wie weit Menschen gehen können, um zu überleben und zu gedeihen.

Fazit:
RimWorld ist nicht einfach nur ein Spiel – es ist ein Erlebnis. Es fordert deine Kreativität, Strategie und Empathie, während es dich mit einzigartigen Geschichten belohnt, die du nie vergessen wirst. Für Fans von Aufbausimulationen, Strategie und Survival ist RimWorld ein absolutes Muss. Ein Meisterwerk, das seinen Platz in jeder Spielesammlung verdient hat. 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

184815666.review:
理由はどうであれ、あなたは未知の惑星へと降り立った。宇宙船の事故か、それとも新天地への志か——ここには、どちらにせよ文明の痕跡もほとんどない。ただ生きるための荒野が広がっている。あなたは小さな小屋を建て、原始的な農業を始め、狩りをして糧を得る。春夏秋冬の過酷な自然を耐え抜きながら、生存の術を学んでいく。

やがて、少しずつ仲間が増えた。時には心優しい入植者たち、時には襲撃者たちを返り討ちにして得た奴隷や戦利品たち——その全てが、この集落を支える力となる。仲間たちは戦士として成長し、子どもたちが生まれ、新しい命が町に彩りを添える。外壁が築かれ、豊富な備蓄と共に、町はついに安定を見せ始めた。

「これで、もう安心だ。新しい故郷を築き上げた。」
そう思った矢先、空に影が落ちる。

それは機械仕掛けの怪物たち、そして高度な文明を持つ侵略者たちだった。
彼らは人間を「動物以下のただの攻撃対象」としか見ていない。
圧倒的な技術と数の前に、歴戦の戦士たちは次々と命を散らす。
炎に包まれる町、備蓄が焼き尽くされ、女子供がさらわれる。

あなた自身も襲撃を受け、片目を失いながらも奇跡的に生き残った。

残されたのは、焼け野原と手足の無い数名の仲間だけ。
冬の寒さは容赦なく、飢えが容赦なく襲う。
作物は育たず、道は一つしかない。

「他の村を襲撃し、奪い生き延びる」こと。

生き延びるためのその選択が、新たな敵意を呼び、さらなる襲撃を引き起こす。
襲うか、襲われるか。生存競争は終わらない。

技術を高めれば、敵の襲撃はさらに苛烈となり、完璧に思えた町ですら一夜にして灰になる。
それでも、再び立ち上がる。

あなたは何度も負け、失敗し、次はより良い結果を掴む為に知恵を絞り、強くなり、賢くなる。
それは終わりなき物語——だが、そこにこそ命の輝きがある。
焼け落ちた町から何度も立ち上がる灰まみれの入植者たちが紡ぐ、果てなき挑戦の物語が、今も続いている。(プレイ時間4500時間)

184810506.review:
RimWorld is a very fun game. At first I saw reviewers or "worth it" videos and mostly other youtubers playing the game. It seemed very interesting at first glance. So, I saved up and bought the game. At first it was not as exciting as I would love it to be. It seemed really disappointing compared to the original hype I had. So, I was thinking that I made a mistake but I went and said "I'll keep playing it, I mean I did spend my money on this, how bad could it possibly be." Oh boy I was wrong. The more I played the game, the more I became invested in it. I would face new challenges, new events, many colony restarts and many tough runs. It has a lot of storytelling potential, like I mean a lot. If there was a higher meaning of interpretation then I would go with that because this game does it really well. At least from my perspective. I think for me and maybe for others, at first glance it might not seem all that interesting to you but give the game a chance and it might blow your mind or confirm the worse. The best thing is you now know. This time it paid off. Even with my hours in the game, I still haven't explored everything about RimWorld nor it's DLCs which have even more content. Plus with mods? This game has a lot of replayability.

I highly recommend this game, if you like colony sim building, storytelling, combat, and pretty much all the above you would expect from a game like this.

184754181.review:
Excellent comme jeu, addictif, je recommande pour s'amuser avec ce jeu de commencer une histoire avec vos protagoniste et leur objectif/ style de jeu, n'ayez pas peur de perdre des colons au cours de l'aventure c'est ce qui fait le sel du jeu. 

De très nombreux mods facilement ajoutables pour diversifier le jeu (un must have au vu de la qualité et du gameplay que ça ajoute). Au niveau des DLC biotech est pour moi un must have, pour les mech notamment. Mais je conseille de vous renseigner pour ajouter de la profondeur aux autres dlc avec des mods (plus royalty et ideology), je n'ai pas encore réussi à accrocher à anomalie malgré que les évents aléatoires soient très cool. 

Vous n'aurez jamais deux parties qui se ressemblent et les histoires racontés sont ce qui fait le coeur du jeu, un soigneur mystique qui transforme un bras en tentacule, un colon fraichement convertis qui réussit à soigner la quasi totalité de la colonie après une attaque mal géré, s'imaginer les histoires de vos colons et les interactions qui en découle est vraiment pourquoi j'adore ce jeu. 

La diversité de scénario est incroyable aussi, une tribu qui devient transhumaniste remplaçant leur membres par des prothèses, un empire de la drogue à la breaking bad, une apocalypse zombie, (avec des mods) pour plus d'idées je vous conseille les tonnes de vidéos qu'il existent sur youtube autour de ça, et en parlant de contenu le subreddit rimworld contient aussi des BD/dessins/animations de situations des colons de joueurs que j'adore regarder.

En bref, jouez à ce jeu et pensez à ajouter des mods

What I thought would be a quaint little distraction turned out to be my second highest played game of all time, and when you transpose the happenings of your colony into the theatre of imagination, the stories actually become somewhat memorable. During my time(s) on rimworld I:
>Failed my firstborn child through neglect, when she got killed and eaten by a cougar
>Got divorced and murdered my spouse
>Found out my partner is gay but forcibly impregnated her via IVF anyways.
>Lost my best friend when he, wandering sick with the flu,  wandered into a trap corridor and stepped on a high explosive mine.  He didn't survive, surprisingly.
>Bred an army of 60 elephants and crushed all colonies within a 10 day radius
>Resorted to cannibalism during a winter famine.

and thats a very small fraction, Life is hard out on the rim, ya know?

The game plus the Xpacs is kind of cost prohibitive,  but this man deserves to be compensated well for his craft, and it has a healthy amount of mods if you're tight on money

184665847.review:
At first it was a really cool game but in depth it doesn't match to kenshi, or frostpunk or any other sim games that jump around the genre, only anomaly is a bit good because all it implies is the atmosphere and lore where the other dlcs don't really care, it delivers.

it's still a cool game to jump around and play sometimes but I can finish it now in under a day of real life. it's challenges are really not real only artificial and are neglected because of things like : 

Farming Crops; however that happens they grow anyway or you don't need to get seeds from anything or anywhere it's already infinite under your pawns ability and if you got hydroponics nothing can stop you except blight that happens rarely.

Raids:In reality in a rim world sure there could be hostiles but not this much every 3 days you'll encounter a Raid depending at the pace of your growth. I can not believe how they got  to 225 pawns trying to raid my base because I have a throne room make it make sense artificial difficulty. If you want you can technically cheese raid AI if you land in a mountain side, and settle in mountain if you don't build anything outside they won't break it only attempt to attack and leave you.

Mining:  you can mine everywhere which do not make any sense without tools or upgrades kinda breaks the whole challenge aspect if I start with mining 10s all over.

Hunger: your pawns do not store fat or something as artificial it is the hunger rate is insanely stupid even with the difficulty, your pawns will die in 7 days without food and 4 - 3 days without anything any food they will drop them unconscious. A whole bison is only enough to let them survive 3 days.  after that they fall starving unconscious.

End note: I'm trying to convey, explain that what this game trying to achieve with difficulty is only pushed artificially and do not feel immersive. if you understand how they work you can exploit them and never worry about anything.

to a point even something like ONI achieves way better without having any outside threat.
 
if you want to start over I may suggest one of the other games above.

1.5にアップデートされてから、Harmonyを導入しているとタイトル画面が表示されず真っ黒になり、カーソルだけ表示されたり、タイトル画面は出るもののボタンが表示されず進めないといった現象が起きていました。
思いつくあらゆることをやってみましたが効果なく途方に暮れていたところ、「1.5のharmonyはセキュリティ対策のASLRを有効にする必要がある」という情報をDiscordで知りました。
導入していたウイルスソフトを一旦削除し、Windowsセキュリティ→アプリとブラウザーコントロール→Exploit Protection→仮想メモリの割当をランダム化する（ボトムアップASLR）をオンにしました。
これで正常に動作するようになりました。同じ症状で困っている方は試してみてください。

"The Geneva Convention? You mean the Geneva Suggestion?"

   Rimworld is one of my favorite games of all time, and my single favorite simulation game, period. The base game is an excellent colony management game that seamlessly blends together a lot of different systems to create a cohesive experience. And the best part is its customizability. You can play a standard colony, fighting to get your colonists off the rim, or a tribal group hellbent on dominating the other civilizations, or even a single person striving to become as technologically advanced as possible. Complete with a rich modding scene, this game will give you hours upon hours, and that's not even counting the DLC.
   
   Speaking of the DLC, I think each of the four expansion packs are worth the money, but I'll go into a bit more detail. [u] Royalty [/u] gives you an entire new faction to have fun with, as well as framework for ascending the empire and developing your colonists' psychic abilities, or doing so on their own and cutting out the middleman. It's a great DLC that I'd recommend picking up once you know you like the game. [u] Ideology [/u] is more of a roleplaying expansion, allowing you to create and develop belief systems for your colonists, with effects and impacts ranging from minimal to game-changing. That said, it can be easy to overlook compared to the others, so I'll only recommend it to those who really like the game and want a bit more, though I think it is very worth it for those players. [u] Biotech [/u] is in my opinion the most important DLC. From the gene sequencing, childbirth and raising, and the mechanoid content, this is the expansion I'd honestly recommend picking up alongside the base game, it just doesn't feel complete without it, and not even in a way that makes you feel cheated out of base game content. [u] Anomaly [/u] is an interesting one. Centered around horror, it is by far the biggest departure from the game's original style, but it's one I have a deep appreciation for. Also a highly recommended expansion, but like Ideology, I'd only recommend it to those who know the game and know that they want more.
   Overall, an excellent game even in the base package, I will sing the game's praises until the end of time, or everyone on earth has a copy.

184597661.review:
10/10. Everyone may have their preferences but this experience is addicting but rewarding.
This game is a masterpiece inspiring the creative human mind to make its own world and story. It can be as calm or as mad as you want it to be and allow outlandish tactics to be used with extreme prejudice. You can lead the story of a farm, a ranch, a band of robbers, an explorer and many and I do mean many others. This is Rimworld and anything goes but that also includes your enemies.
Be aware that while you may seek a calm life, people never seem to just leave people alone.
You can try to make as many friends as you want and they will help you in your conflicts, but you will always find your people being threatened, attacked, kidnapped, blackmailed and so on.
This is Rimworld, anything goes.

I've had farmers defend their land with rifles and fortifications, only to be fired upon by artillery from more tech savvy raiders.
I've had colonists die from infections and sickness, medicine doing nothing, not even delaying the inevitable, watching an entire person's being get washed away like water.
I've seen attacks by battle platforms wielding miniguns and needle casting projectiles into poor saps from several miles.
People ripped apart by giant insects that look like the preying mantis on TREN and other performance improving drugs that are most definitely illegal elsewhere.
But this is Rimworld and anything goes.

You observe the training of dogs and have generations of people and canine living side by side.
You observe the people who watch auroras and all its beauty.
You observe a man cheat on his wife (which the wife has brain damage) with the wife's mother, who is only one year apart and doesn't have brain damage.
You observe this man get shot repeatedly with shotguns and rifles by raiders. Just for him to somehow stand back up and realise all those bullets glanced off his depleted uranium plate armour. Then proceed to chop their limbs off to defend said wife who he cheated on.
This is Rimworld and anything goes.

Now I'm going to explain the one thing that everyone doesn't want to admit.
If you play this game you will be complicit in a war crime at some point within it, don't hide from that fact.
You can play as nice as you want, you can be the best that you can be, but eventually you will do a war crime and it won't even phase you.
When you get attacked by raiders for the 500th time because you didn't feel like paying them off, you may observe colonists shooting to wound and then accidentally execute the wounded.
You may be complicit in the accidental burning of hundreds of people or the slaughtering of an entire room of people with a cleaver.
You may do genetic experiments on prisoners like the Third Reich and chop their legs off so they can't perform prison breaks every other month, because the room they're living in, isn't plated with gold. We don't have money growing in trees!

This is the Rimworld and in said world, anything goes. Because there is no government and so the Geneva Convention becomes the "Geneva Suggestion".

This game taught me the appeal of war crimes.
Therefore with the release of this review I must add the disclaimer.
"This is Rimworld and anything goes, so if you don't get your foot off my land I'm going to have you shot to death with birdshot."
Actually maybe I'll just tell the galaxy known master of melee themself do the work.

184542132.review:
rimworld, even without mods & its official dlc, is already an extremely content-dense game that will suck your soul dry, having a ton of replayability and things to strive for. the dlcs (minus anomaly) all add giant building blocks to add even more diversity and replayability to your colonies. vanilla, and all the dlcs, is already so much to play and do.

then, on top of it all, an extremely versatile modding community with a wide variety of options to make your ideal experience, whether it be completely overhauling system mechanics and visuals or simply expanding upon everything in vanilla+ style. i don't often like to focus on mods with games and their quality, but having such a robust modding community only strengthens rimworld's already absurd appeal without them. it's fantastic.

for the dlcs, they're all absolutely worth it, but if you have to pick one, pick biotech. it's the most important one due to the gene system & just ALL the stuff it adds around it like the sanguophages and more importantly the mechinator role & questline. after biotech, i'd prioritize ideology first, then royalty. 

anomaly is the least important, as it's basically a high difficulty event-oriented scp/horror expansion all about securing and containing monsters. it's VERY fun, but only when you actually want to engage with it. otherwise it's just an annoyance and i play with it off completely on most of my saves. 

rimworld's only real issue is performance particularly in the late game when giga-raids start happening and you have a ton of colonists, and how long start-up can be when you have a lot of mods. a small price to pay.

184406489.review:
While Rimworld is fun and engaging, I feel it lacks content for its price (especially the DLCs) and often results in RNG standoffs between your dumb colonists and the even dumber raiders.

It is incredibly addicting for the first couple hours however, it declines very quickly, devolving into micromanagement hell where colonists have to be practically manually controlled unable to do the most common tasks like eating, all the while the narrator throws random scenarios to *build tension* by killing your colonists one by one in increasingly unfair situations (entire colony gets the plague, solar flare disables defences as 2000 point raid appears, colonist shoots another colonist in the head despite standing in front of them.)

I would not recommend Rimworld for any beginners or anyone on a budget, however, if you have $40 to waste (+ $80 if you want the full game and not a demo), Rimworld is worth a shot.

184300629.review:
很值得购买并体验的殖民模拟管理（同时有即时回合制战略的因素并且较多）游戏。有令人深思的地方。游戏里有一句提示：本游戏只是在模拟管理，并非是对玩家能力的检验，殖民地的覆灭只是一幕悲剧而不是失败。这格局啊，一下就起来了。所以你也不用玩得太紧张。

单局游戏时间极长。

殖民管理：整体来说没什么难度，要管理的方面数量一般，都不复杂，比如种植植物只用管温度，光照，土壤肥沃度，不用种子，不需人的照料，动物养殖也简单（所以食物肯定不会缺）。比缺氧，群星简单很多。最危险的就是野生动物（捕食者，狼，狮子什么的，攻击力强）的突然袭击，容易死人。只有这个地方有点难度。

战斗（当然是与敌对势力的）：这个部分在游戏中和殖民管理一样重要，甚至战斗更重要，比较频繁。有时会有动物或敌人入侵你的殖民地（你的地盘）。战斗是回合制，每个人都有命中率和闪避率，战斗中可以指挥你的人攻击谁，走到哪里（找掩体）。整体来说比较需要策略安排，装备和运气也很重要。通过战斗（和人的，动物可不讲理，不会被关起来后不攻击你）可能得到俘虏，怎么处置可以自由选择。（其中有残忍的部分，这比较引人深思）

各种细节：人物有各种特质，有背景故事（能看）；所有人都有心情，会被各种事情影响，比如亲友死亡，极端温度，饿，吃的食物的品质，没有娱乐休息的时间等，心情只要低于一定阙值就有崩溃的可能（这点有点恶心，尤其是你遇到袭击时，人崩溃了他就不干活也不听话了！）；人会因为各种原因受伤，没有整体生命值，各部位有其独立的生命条，为0时它就不复存在了，部位受伤时会影响效率（有计算公式并会显示出来），疼痛度会影响心情，达到一定值人会倒地等待救援。

画质：就是截图中显现的风格。有点极简主义的感觉（建模和人物物品的贴图）。光影处理得很好，会随时间变动而不同（真实）。音乐音效也不错。

184284898.review:
While RimWorld offers a lot of depth in colony management and storytelling, its heavy reliance on repetitive tower-defense mechanics completely breaks the immersion.

The premise of three people crash-landing on a planet and immediately facing endless waves of attacks from random animals, lone wanderers, and escalating groups of raiders makes no sense. Why would someone risk their life to attack a barely established colony? And why is digging defensive positions one of the first things my survivors need to do after crashing? It feels absurd and completely out of place in a game that otherwise seems to focus on realism and survival.

Even on a relaxed storyteller like Phoebe Chillax and with a low difficulty setting, the game forces combat scenarios that feel like cheap attempts to artificially increase tension. Losing a colonist to a random attacker early on is frustrating, not fun.

If you're looking for a survival simulation with meaningful progression and immersion, RimWorld struggles to deliver. The focus on tower defense like nonsensical combat severely undermines its otherwise promising gameplay.

e 5th Jan 2025

Проиграв около 200 часов на пиратке приобрел игру в стиме, о чем я вообще не пожалел.
Мне очень нравится что-то строить, создавать и заниматься микроменеджментом, поэтому эта игра просто идеальна для меня. Вам открывается достаточно большой простор для творчества внутри своей колонии, а с дополнениями и установкой модов варианты отыгрыша увеличиваются в несколько раз. Однако после установки модов вам уже вряд ли захочется возвращаться в ванильную игру.
Главный и самый жирный минус игры в том, что размеры и мощность вашей колонии грубо говоря зависит от производительности вашего ПК. После продолжительной игры и увеличения количества поселенцев в игре заметно начинает проседать FPS и это касается даже достаточно мощных ПК. Очень надеюсь, что разработчики обратят внимание на эту проблему и постараются решить её.

184081540.review:
我无法用语言来形容我对这个游戏的感觉，它好像成为了我生命中的一部分。

我是那种玩游戏很杂的，什么游戏都玩，什么游戏都不会玩很久的人。在环世界之前，游戏时间最长的也都是彩六和csgo这种网游，当然也没多长就是了。

当初这个游戏还在测试阶段就买了，放了好几年没动过。直到后来刺客信条奥德赛和古墓丽影这两罐头给我整出电子阳痿，才在库里翻一翻老物件。

结果发现这游戏居然度过EA测试，出到1.3的正式版了，那就想着玩一玩呗。因为当初是看老菊视频买的游戏，所以把老菊的视频又看了一遍，觉得版本还是有点太老了，当新手教程有点不合适。

然后在B站上找到了一个做教程的UP，这个UP讲的很细，跟着她的网课学了一段时间，但可能正因为讲的太细，反而让我抓不住要点。

就像老师一股脑把知识塞给你，重难点不做区分，让你头晕脑胀。毕竟这游戏确实是属于信息量很大，很难上手的那一类。

接下来就是在B站上面搜来搜去，看看还有什么UP做新手教程，然后就看到了白洋。是他带我入了这个游戏的门。跟着他的视频开了个档，流程走到一半，就有种豁然开朗的感觉，我感觉到有点懂这个游戏了。

后来，就是在贴吧高强度冲浪，从贴吧其他人那里吸收关于这个游戏的知识，补上对于这个游戏基础认知的最后几块拼图。

再后来，随着贴吧逛的越来越多，关于这个游戏的视频也看得越来越多，游戏时长越来越长，对这个游戏也越加了解，感觉到游戏本体的内容有点不太够玩了，于是补上了DLC，当DLC的内容也玩得差不多了之后，就开始接触有趣的、大型的MOD。

现在我在玩的这个档，时间跨度已经有现实中的一年了，一直在不断往这个档增减MOD，以保持这个档的新鲜感。

为什么不开新档？也许是这个档玩的太久，让我也或多或少，对这个档里的小人产生了一些感情吧。

我对于这个游戏的回忆就回忆到这里了。在这1400多小时的游玩过程中，它带给我的成就感和愉快的游戏体验用再多语言描述也是苍白无力的，我也无意再赘述我对它的好感度有多高了。

最后，泰南你真得给mod制作者爹们磕几个响头，这游戏评价，这游戏销量，有多少是为爱发光的mod制作者给你挣得，就不用多说了。

184075076.review:
I don't know what it is about this game, but it has such a unique charm for being something as simple as it is. It's one of the only games in my library where I genuinely get excited to see new updates and DLC for, and one even fewer I'm mostly willing to drop my money instantly upon it. I've soaked so many hours into this game just chilling out, listening to music, all the while simply trying to expand and enhance my base. I don't even know hours have passed most of the time.

Of course, the game isn't without it's flaws, but even they tend to end up with whacky or otherwise amusing stories, as by design of the game (it is a story generator, after all). One of my personal favorites was the infamous "Ate without table, so now I'm gonna do something stupid."

Nikolai had already been in a pretty terrible mood, but something about just not having that table ended up causing him to snap. His only recourse would be to attempt to fist fight a rhino.

He lived, following the giant hole in his chest being tended. Since then, he seems to have learned to choose his targets much more carefully.

Rimworld, Rimworld... the well-known atrocities sim. 

Randy Random is by far the best storyteller. The other ones will eventually aim to push you out of your own game.

Beyond that, it is important to emphasize this is yet another sandbox game. All of your goals are truly self-dictated. How you go about surviving has no one right guide, and how you play the game after surviving is up to you.

The pawns of course add some fun randomness that the game is well-known for, with their mental breaks.

There is a lot of content to explore the biotech DLC is pretty good. Overall good sandbox survival game.

183899461.review: I have just over 700 hours of playtime, and I've never regretted a single one. The beauty of this game is just how customizable devs allow it to be. You can play against a brutal unforgiving "storyteller", what this game calls the game ai, or nerf it completely in your world settings. You can even do this after starting your colony, so if you find your initial settings too difficult you can lower them until they are more suited to your taste. The DLC is completely unnecessary, easily only counting for only the last 100 hours of playtime. You should really only consider purchasing DLC once you've fully explored the meaty base game as most DLC serves to add new mechanics and play styles, none of it is "necessary" in that sense. Check out mods too, the plethora is vast and plenty are exceptional additions to vanilla.

183868050.review:
История моего первого запуска этого "симулятора колонии":

С самого начала всё пошло не так, как планировалось. Я выбрал трёх колонистов: пьяницу с синдромом выживания, учёного с тягой к огню и ветерана войны, который не держал в руках ничего, кроме своей любимой лопаты. Тут же началась вечеринка: нашу первую ночь под открытым небом украсила небо звёздами, а насекомые, похоже, проводили конкурс на звание "Кто будет кусать сильнее".

Тем не менее, я с оптимизмом строил первую хижину. Планы на будущее были грандиозные: огороды, скот и даже туалет! Но вот незадача — пьяница превратил наши запасы пищи в вечеринку на кухне. Он же попытался разобраться с автоматической пушкой на крыше, считая её "стильным декором". Уровень стиля не помог, и вскоре я нашёл его, изогнутым в нелепой позе, зажатым в углу, извиняющимся перед дикими ушастыми зайцами, которые явно были напуганы.

Прошло несколько дней, и когда я думал, что ничего хуже быть не может, на горизонте появились местные жители. Я готовился к дипломатии, но вместо этого столкнулся с банде воинов, которые не хотели ничего кроме разорения. Мой учёный увидел в этом прекрасную возможность для научных экспериментов и начал строить лук с стрелами, вместо того чтобы скорее всего встать на борьбу. Результат? Пара стрел в воздухе и ещё один колонист, который освоил навык "бегство".

В самый разгар хаоса я решил, что пора приложить свои силы к охоте. Я всегда был хорош в стрельбе, хоть и не понимал, почему кто-то выбирает лук вместо пистолета. В итоге, я подстрелил самого крупного гнусного зверя на планете — пока он не пришёл в ярость и не побежал за мной с угрюмым видом, заставив учёного искать, куда бы укрыться.

В конце концов, моя колония развалилась, как карточный домик. Я остался с мёртвым учёным, пьяным колонистом, который решил, что пчёлы — это злобные духи, и ветераном, который построил самую крепкую шалаш в мире, но открыл его только для себя. Понятие об идеальной колонии в RimWorld убивалось на глазах, и я думал: "На что мы потратили своё время?"

Зная, что я не учёл уроки этой безумной цивилизации, я просто закрыл игру. Всё это время, я не искал выживания — я просто искал смысл. Может, в следующем запуске всё будет лучше... или я, наконец, начну давать шанс другим, менее шальным колониям.

183787279.review:
You may hear of, some things of questionable or dubious morality.

You may hear tell of, war crimes, human leather hats, canniibalism, organ harvesting, and miscellaneous horrors both within and outside the confines of human conceptualization.

Are these all intended features of my favorite game ever? Yes. But let me answer a different question that you may be wondering.

Yes, you can also have a happy thriving colony of safe people who bake bread and where clothes made from ethnically harvested cotton, selling weed, or perhaps still just bread to get the money to sustain yourself. The horrors never go away though, regardless of if you have Anomaly installed or not. Your favorite colonist getting their brain liquified by a stray friendly fire shot is a canon experience.

That is to say, yes, this game lets you be a psychopath, but it also works insanely well if you dont at all want to be that. And thats what makes it perfect. Never has a game, especially with the support of our massive modding community, been able to so perfectly allow you to literally be whoever you want.

I suppose it could all be summed down to this one beautiful example I've heard from, somewhere. I dont remember. 

"No two people who are playing (modded) Rimworld are playing the same game. One is playing a sci-fi colony survival game. One is playing a medieval base builder. One is building a 100 colonist communist megacity. One is playing a dwarven monarch with 40 peasants slaving away for their opulence. One is playing an anime RPG where all of their characters are borderline invincible and oneshotting everything. One is playing a spaceship manager. One is recreating Mad Max as a strategy game. One is playing a war crime simulator. And all of them, are liable to agree that this is a top 3 game ever."

183729720.review:
[h2]シミュレーション系ゲームの神作 [/h2]

プレイヤーはそれぞれ諸事情を抱えて惑星に降り立ったクルーを操作してコロニーを築き最終目標として惑星への脱出を目指します。
その中で生きていく上での食料問題や外部からの襲撃、人間関係のストレスや住む上での快適さなど細かな問題まで幅広くケアしてあげる必要があります。
生きてりゃいいでしょ、と怠るとツケがまわりクルーが脱走します。(笑)

ゲーム内で出来る設定、項目の自由度はかなり高く出来ないことがほとんどないです。
完成度は群を抜いて高く上記の自由度に比較してバグなども少なければ操作面でストレスを感じることも少ないです。
これだけでこのゲームが他のシミュレーションより頭一つ抜けていると断言できます。

各クルーにも得手不得手がありどんなに万能なヒト1人でも長くは持たないでしょう。
奴隷、捕虜、遭難者などコロニーには新たな人員が必要な場面も多くクルーの数がコロニーの強さに直結します。
このあたりがやけに現実に基づいたバランスが取れていると実感しますね。

ゲームに慣れてきた段階で細かな難易度を変えるだけで今までとは違う熾烈さを体験できるのも良点
・次に来るクルーは前回より出来損ないかも？
・次の土地は食料の確保が難しい痩せた土地かも？
・はたまた寒暖差が激しく温度管理が難しいかも？
シチュエーションは千差万別のため一度クリアしたノウハウを活かしても次のシナリオは余裕とならないのがこのゲームが無限に遊べる所以かもしれません。

183723341.review:
You know how some girls will get The Sims 4 and then start doing terrible, awful things to their sim's neighbors like locking them in the basement to churn out art pieces so their sims can do whatever they like without having to get a job? Rimworld is The Sims for boys. 

Crashland in the middle of the wilderness and use the resources to build a shelter for your little ragtag group of survivors, research new tech that will unlock new ways to conquer the local wildlife and hostile tribes of raiders so that they know you are not to be trifled with and then capture them when they do and force them to slave away at the menial work your OG settlers have been doing this entire time like chopping forests or mining ores. Of course, if your new workers just aren't a good fit, you can always have your doctor hone his skills harvesting their organs or limbs to add to your freezer for the coming winter. Or better yet you could just skin everyone you don't like and turn that leather into fancy hats that you can sell to the wandering traders in exchange for a full set of winter clothes for all your loyal colonists. 

This game can be as chilled out or as punishing as you wish. It all depends on what kind of story you want to tell and which storyteller you pick before you start. There is also excellent mod support in this game to tweak things exactly to your liking.

183646870.review:
[u]Base, modded RimWorld; no DLC.[/u]

An absolute time sinker of a game, and for very good reasons.

I've had someone describe RimWorld to me as, and I quote, [i]"soy dwarf fortress."[/i] I can't comment any further (I've never played DF), but while the comparison might make sense at first glance, the two games differ significantly in gameplay. Where Dwarf Fortress focuses on world generation, RimWorld generates stories. Macro vs. micro, impersonal vs. interpersonal—it’s not so much comparing apples to oranges as it is comparing oranges to mandarins. That said, RimWorld is far more casual-friendly, with intuitive UI and approachable gameplay. Its world, however, feels more like a small neighbourhood—one where the neighbours are idiots. And their houses are on fire. Everything's on fire.

RimWorld is a game where you'll be screaming at idiotic pawns to stop fighting one another and finish building the coolers so they can store food for winter, and you'll be doing that far more often than you'd expect. After 100 hours of gameplay, all with a single colony, I feel like I’ve only just started to find a footing that works for my colonists’ survival.

100 hours, and you still haven't beaten the game? That's stupid! Well, most of that time is spent preparing and recovering from all of the events any one of the three chosen Storyteller AI decides to throw at you. And that's assuming your colony can survive. Being a 'story generator [strike]by Tynan Sylvester[/strike]' you can change how the game will play out to suit your preferences. Absolutely nothing going on in your perfect, peaceful colony? Sure! Literal Hell itself? Well it's your funeral.

The soundtrack is perfect, bar none—one of the best OSTs I've heard in any game, ever. It's up there with games like [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1734320/Brutal_Orchestra/]Brutal Orchestra[/url]. I genuinely don't know how Alistair Lindsay did it, but every track is a masterpiece. It's a shame it’s not available on Spotify, or I'd be dragging a Discord bot into the call whenever my friends and I are playing. I cannot gush over it enough; it's that good.

And then there are the mods... [i]As if the base game wasn't chaotic enough.[/i] Some players argue that RimWorld is almost unplayable without them, and I’d have to agree. They can fix stuff, like the stupid pawn AI and slow hauling, or introduce entirely new mechanics, items, and quality-of-life improvements. Want your pawns to act a little less idiotic? There’s a mod for that. Want to turn your colony into a high-tech utopia or a medieval village? Mods. As everyone says, mods increase the lifetime of a game indefinitely, and RimWorld is like no other.

It's the most expensive game in my library thus far having bought it at ~RM60+ in a bundle, and the DLCs alone are even more! The game + DLCs rarely go on sale above 10%~20%. Based on their descriptions, I don't think any of them will be landing a place in my account. Mods already handle much of the heavy lifting, especially fixing issues that have persisted since the game's release, or adding much needed content/QoL fixes. That's not a good look on the developers end, and I hope they realise this soon enough.

Overall, the game isn’t perfect—far from it. Whether it’s an issue with the game itself or some external factor, it has its flaws. However, despite all that, I still wholeheartedly recommend it. If you can, buy it during the rare moments when it goes on sale.

And remember: [b]Losing is fun![/b]

[i]So... Are you still waiting for the sun?[/i]

Highlights:

Deep and Engaging Gameplay: Managing colonists, resources, and threats provides a constant challenge.

Minor Drawbacks:

Steep Learning Curve: The game can be overwhelming for newcomers.
Can be Frustrating: Unexpected disasters and unfortunate events can be frustrating.
Overall:

RimWorld is a must-play for fans of colony sims, strategy games, and emergent storytelling. Despite its challenging nature, the game offers an incredibly rewarding and unforgettable experience.

Rating: 9/10
