183573555.review:
Honestly, how is anyone supposed to talk about why a game like this is so good? Well the only thing I can think of is to tell my favourite story about the game.

So at the time I had all the DLC (royalty, ideology, and biotech) and wanted to try out a hedonistic playthrough where my colonists are a drug cartel. Pick randy, pick a jungle, go with the default scenario, and start.

Everything is going well, colony is slowly growing and I've got a basic base going with my next task being to start drug manufacturing next. Do the research, plant the crops, get the workbenches ready. Thing is I hadn't set up a kill box, and despite being drug lords my colonists were more lovers than fighters so a raid comes along. 

Get my three soldiers to meet them and they win but are they're badly hurt, one of them dies. Turns out, everyone liked that guy, so everyone is just a bit upset. It's a shame, I'll have one less person to fight back and have to deal with a bunch of hedonists in a bad mood, a burial should help. 

It's a terrible burial. Mood drops some more. That's annoying, but so long as nothing bad happens I should be fine. Things start to recover slowly until Randy from up above decides to do a little trolling. 

You see, playing this map made me wonder why everyone thought grasslands was the best map type. Jungle was grasslands but you didn't get winter and just had to deal with the heat. The ground was also more fertile and there were more animals. Randy told me why, diseases.

SO, just about everyone gets a parasite. Not lethal, but I wish it was since the guy who died was also the only doctor. I hadn't saved in a while so I had to bear the brunt of it with the only person even able to do doctoring having a skill of 2, which is terrible. At this rate recovery would take forever. Fine, I'll just wait. Which is fine for a bit, but boring. I guess Randy thought the same thing. I could imagine that maniac chuckling to himself after having some smokeleaf thinking, "dude, what if?" before pressing a big red button that says "raid".

Another raid comes, all my soldiers are in so much pain that they literally couldn't get out of bed to save their lives. The raiders came in, burnt a lot of the colony to the ground, and decided to just kidnap some poor sick colonist and then leave.

The few people who aren't too sick and are alive are so distraught between the mess, the death of colonists, how hot the jungle is, the kidnapping, not having a table to eat on, and everything else that they just break down. Most of them doing it while the colony is burning. 

One person is still sane and healthy but miserable. She was going to break any minute now, and I knew that this colony was done for. So I locked her in her room and waited for everyone to calm down. I wanted the colony to perish on my own terms and for my amusement.

There was a chapel of hedonism where the colonists would gather to have sexy fun times and get high, a holy site for them. Had the colony prosper, it could have been a pilgrimage site for hedonists across the planet. Now, it was to be the final resting place for my colonists. 

Somehow, the last sane colonists stayed sane enough to drag everyone into the chapel with wooden furnishings that survived the fire. I didn't have any chemfuel, rimworld's version of petrol, but I did have this game's version of a molotov which I scavenged off a dead raider.

Standing in the middle of the chapel near breaking point, surrounded by the people she loves and some of the people she hates, threw a molotov at the furniture.

The doors were locked and the fire grew, smoke filled the chapel and the temperature rised. She stood there for as long as she could bear it, the other colonists could only lie there sick and in pain as they watched. Temperature reached boiling point, then hot enough to burn paper, then clothing. The colonists' clothes caught on fire, she began to run around frantically trying to bust the door open. The chapel was the only building made out of stone, including the door. She never stood a chance. Not long after, she collapsed on the floor besides her other colonists. Though I made her do it, I like to imagine that she regretted her decision.

Enough of my colonists died that a mysterious stranger ran into the colony. Maybe he saw the smoke and thought someone needed help. When he got there, everyone was already charred. I made him leave, I wanted this colony to be finished so I could start over. For the mysterious stranger, I imagine that he didn't see a point in staying behind for corpses,; there wasn't even anything to bury. 

Before he left, Randy played one more joke on me and the colony. A lost shipment of supplies landed on my map. I hovered over and the supplies were wood. The stranger crossed the wood that came from the sky, and he likely thought the place was cursed. I thought the same.

He went past the map boundary, and the game declared the base destroyed.

If that story appeals to you at all, buy it and play it. There's not many games like it, and mods will make this game infinitely replayable. This is my second most played game, and I can see myself playing it for thousands of hours. It easily could be the same for you.

183572141.review: No hay mucho que pueda decir de Rimworld, por lo menos nada que no se haya dicho ya, pero de todas formas (y teniendo en cuenta que estoy aburrido y solo por eso hago esta reseña), lo intentare. Haber, Rimworld es un contador de historias, inicias una partida y el objetivo nunca esta del todo claro, la "misión principal" de huir del mundo se te olvida rápido, si es que iniciaste en dificultad baja probablemente te entretengas mejorando la base, investigando, reclutando, etc. Aunque si juegas en media o mi preferida, "esforzarse por sobrevivir", es mucho mas probable que estés ocupado defendiéndote, atendiendo alguna enfermedad, preparando defensas y usando ese poco tiempo que el juego te suelta para avanzar antes de ser brutalmente golpeado por lo que se le salga de los huevos al narrador, pero... cuando por X o Y razón termines muriendo o perdiendo lo suficiente como para salir del juego o iniciar otra partida, te quedaras con una historia para recordar, te acordaras de como alguno de tus colonos murió por un ataque de ardillas devora hombres (ojala fuera un chiste), y eso es otra cosa, las situaciones que hay durante la partida pueden ser serias, como una invasión de piratas fuertemente armados, o puede ser que una rata se auto domestico solo para ser devorada dos días después por un lobo pardo. Hasta aquí la reseña solo habla del juego base, te interesa alguno de los DLCs? Perfecto, son bastante buenos todos, pero... te advierto, todos menos Anomaly podrían ser simplemente parte del juego base, especialmente Royalty y Ideology (en mi opinión muy personal), sin mencionar el precio, por lo que, en conclusión: Quieres comprar el juego con algún DLC o eres bastante nuevo (<80h jugadas), juega hasta que se te haga realmente repetitivo, y compra un solo DLC a la vez, y deja Anomaly como el ultimo a comprar, es un DLC que agrega contenido que de verdad se siente como una expansión, algo que se siente de verdad "aparte" de todo, pero bueno, a fin de cuentas es tu elección, yo personalmente ya estoy un poco saturado de tanto jugar (van 45h en las ultimas dos semanas) y me voy a dar un descanso, ademas de comprar algún DLC para disfrutar, tenga un buen día y adiós.

183530149.review: This game is amazing, I played it all the time for a solid month straight. It eventually got tiresome playing it and repetitive after every time beating the game. It's an expensive game though since to get the full experience it is around 100$ USD for all the DLCs. Once the base game with DLCs gets boring try modding it! There are hundreds of amazing mods for this game. I played this in college even as a stress remover, but this game can also stress you out if your colonists are in trouble...  Either way this game is an 11/10 and I would heavily recommend it to anyone looking for a fun game to play.

183526205.review:
RimWorld: Una odisea emocional en cada partida

Si los videojuegos son capaces de contar historias, entonces RimWorld es un verdadero poeta. Más que un juego, es una máquina de narrativas que pone a prueba tu ingenio, tu creatividad y, sobre todo, tu corazón.

Desde el primer momento en que aterrizas en ese rincón remoto del universo con un puñado de colonos y un sueño, RimWorld te atrapa. Pero no es una simple experiencia de supervivencia: es un drama interactivo donde cada decisión, por pequeña que sea, puede desencadenar una cadena de eventos que te hará reír, llorar, o incluso lanzar el teclado al suelo.

Tus colonos no son simples personajes; son individuos con historias, pasados y ambiciones. Podrás encariñarte con el médico que siempre salva el día, o con ese constructor torpe que, aunque tarde un año en terminar un edificio, siempre tiene un chiste malo para alegrarte. Sin embargo, la verdadera magia de RimWorld está en su capacidad de enfrentar a estos mismos personajes con desafíos brutales e impredecibles.

Un ataque pirata puede destruir meses de esfuerzo, una plaga puede arrasar con tus cultivos, o una simple disputa entre colonos puede hacer tambalear la estabilidad de toda la colonia. Pero en medio del caos, siempre hay pequeños momentos de belleza: un colono componiendo una obra maestra, un perro fiel que rescata a un camarada herido o una pareja que encuentra el amor en medio del apocalipsis.

El juego no tiene un final fijo porque no lo necesita. Cada partida es una historia única que se graba en tu memoria. Quizás logres escapar del planeta en una nave, o tal vez tu colonia sucumba ante una tormenta de fuego. Pero siempre, siempre sentirás que viviste algo especial.

RimWorld no es solo un juego para quienes disfrutan de la estrategia y la gestión. Es una experiencia para quienes buscan algo más profundo: una ventana a la naturaleza humana, a la lucha por la supervivencia y a la capacidad infinita de contar historias. Si no lo has jugado, prepárate para perderte en un universo donde el drama, la comedia y la tragedia se entrelazan en perfecta armonía.

Te lo digo sin dudar: jugar a RimWorld no es solo recomendable, es imprescindible. 💫

183525610.review: Well, after 1500hrs I feel kind of obligated to post a recommendation. For past few years my absolute favourite single player game. It's the game you launch at 10 to play for 2hrs only to realise you are starting work in an hour, because somehow it's 7 in the morning. Each playthrough will be different, there will be tragedies and huge victories. There will be love and treason, parties with visitors and organ-harvesting operations in some dugout - you name it. Also defenitely worth mentioning great modding potential and community putting tons of time to fit the gameplay in a way you want it.
